Class PayoutTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • PayoutTable

  • public class PayoutTable
extends java.lang.Object
    Establishes a payout table associated with hand qualities.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Dr. Jody Paul

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int TABLE_SIZE
      Maximum number of elements in a PayoutTable.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PayoutTable()
      Creates empty payout table.
      PayoutTable(PayoutTable orig)
      Payout table copy constructor.
      PayoutTable(Quality[] quals, int[] pays)
      Constructs payout table according to the hand qualities and payouts given as parameters.

      • PayoutTable

        public PayoutTable()
        Creates empty payout table.

      • PayoutTable

        public PayoutTable(PayoutTable orig)
        Payout table copy constructor. Shallow copy (values not cloned).
        Parameters:
        orig - the table to be copied

      • PayoutTable

        public PayoutTable(Quality[] quals,
                   int[] pays)
        Constructs payout table according to the hand qualities and payouts given as parameters.
        Parameters:
        quals - Ordered hand qualities
        pays - Corresponding payout multipliers

    • Method Detail

      • payoutTable85

        public static PayoutTable payoutTable85()
        Creates payout table for Jacks or Better 8-5 machine.
        Returns:
        payout table for Jacks-or-Better 8-5 (no progressive)

      • putPayout

        public final void putPayout(Quality quality,
                            int multiplier)
        Updates (adds or replaces) entry in this payout table.
        Parameters:
        quality - the hand quality
        multiplier - the payout multiplier for the associated hand quality

      • getPayout

        public int getPayout(Quality quality)
        Retrieves the appropriate payout for a specified quality.
        Parameters:
        quality - the quality to look up
        Returns:
        the payout multiplier associated with the quality, or 0 if no payout for the quality

      • table

        public final java.util.Map<Quality,java.lang.Integer> table()
        Accesses this payout table as a Map<Quality, Integer>.
        Returns:
        this payout table
